meanings.definition: Feel intense dislike or disgust for.
meanings.sent1: I loathe the taste of broccoli.
meanings.sent3: Even the cat seemed to loathe the new brand of cat food.
meanings.sent4: His eyes seemed to loathe the sight of her.
meanings.sent5: The smell of rotten eggs made her loathe breakfast time.

meanings.sent1: He loathes going to the dentist.
meanings.sent2: They loathe waking up early on weekends.
meanings.sent3: The dog seemed to loathe taking a bath.
meanings.sent4: The tree's roots seemed to loathe being confined in a small pot.
meanings.sent5: The child's face clearly showed he loathed eating his vegetables.
